result.execSummary:
The defendant SHANE R WILLSON was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
PAYABLE TO CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE - 30 days to pay or request a payment plan. 
Due March 9, 2022.
All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Plus supervision fees.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

No contact with J.H. unless consent by J.H and approved by agent.
No verbal or physical abuse of anyone.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment, to include domestic violence assessment and programming and anger management.

Defendant pleads no contest to Count 1 of 22CM9
Defendant pleads no contest to Count 3 of 22CM9
Guilty Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Filed
Defendant Advised of Constitutional Rights.
Defense stipulates to facts of criminal complaint.
Defendant informed of charges and penalties.
Court accepts pleas as freely, voluntarily, and knowingly made and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 3 in 22CM9.
DRI 20CM259 and Count 2 of 22CM9
Court finds 1 night credit if revoked

SENTENCE:
Sentence reserved
Probation for 18 months
No contact with JH unless consent by JH and approved by agent
No physical or verbal abuse of anyone
Domestic violence assessment & programming & anger management
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.
